me.assembla.stringtouri.linkage
Class Linkage

java.lang.Object
  me.assembla.stringtouri.linkage.Linkage
Direct Known Subclasses:
StandardLinkage, TailorLinkage, TypedLinkage
public abstract class Linkage
extends java.lang.Object

Abstract class interlinking two data sets according to criteria.

Version:
2012-07-11
Author:
Thibaud Colas
See Also:

Method Detail

getSourceData

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getSourceData()
                                                                   throws org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException,
                                                                          org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException,
                                                                          org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
Retrieves data for the source predicate from the source data set. One value = one URI, one URI = one value.

Returns:
HashMap where the key is the value for the source predicate and value is the associated URI (subject).
Throws:
org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException - Issue with the source query.
org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - Repository error while fetching data.
org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException - Wrong query result bindings.

getTargetData

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String>> getTargetData()
                                                                                         throws org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException,
                                                                                                org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException,
                                                                                                org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
Retrieves data from the target data set which we want to update. One value is associated with multiple URIs, one URI can be associated with multiple values.

Returns:
Hashmap where a value is associated with the URIs having this value for the target predicate.
Throws:
org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException - Issue with the target query.
org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - Repository error while fetching data.
org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException - Wrong query result bindings.

hasCorrectBindingNames

public final boolean hasCorrectBindingNames(org.openrdf.query.TupleQueryResult tqr)
                                     throws org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException
Tels if the bindings of the results are wel-formed.

Parameters:
tqr - : The result of a SPARQL query.
Returns:
True if the results contain solely both SVAR and OVAR columns.
Throws:
org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException - Error while closing the result.

generateLinks

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.LinkedList<org.openrdf.model.Statement>> generateLinks()
                                                                                                    throws org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException,
                                                                                                           org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException,
                                                                                                           org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
Creates new statements with the updated data.

Returns:
A Hashmap containing statements grouped by their subjects.
Throws:
org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException - Issue with one of the queries.
org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - Repository error while fetching data.
org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException - Wrong query result bindings.

Reformats a predicate / class to make it usable.

Parameters:
str - the predicate / class to clean.

A clean predicate / class.

writeSelectQuery

public java.lang.String writeSelectQuery(java.lang.String predicate,
                                         java.lang.String type,
                                         java.lang.String context)
Writes a SPARQL query to retrieve subject - object pairs for a given predicate, a given subject class and a given context.

Parameters:
predicate - : The predicate to use, including its local namespace.
type - : The subject's data type.
context - : The context for our request.
Returns:
The full SPARQL query.
